
# Getting Started

### Introduction

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;To understand how Portal works,
it is important to understand a few key
terminologies and concepts used by its underlying system. Portal
system's model is mainly composed of objects
called entities. [**Entities**][entity-url] are divided into kinds,
and each kind defines how this entity is created,
managed, and used in Portal's ecosystem.

There are three major kinds
of entities: [**Components**][component-url],
[**APIs**][api-url] and [**Resources**][resources-url]

There are also additional kinds that
organize and give access to the
initial major ones, these ones
being: [**Templates**][template-url], [**Groups**][groups-url],
[**User**][user-url], [**Systems**][system-url], [**Domains**][domain-url].
and [**Locations**][location-url].

**The relationship between entities**


![](https://mermaid.-)
  <br>
  [View and edit online:material-playlist-edit:](https://mermaid.live/edit#-){ .md-mini .md-button .small width="100" }



<br>

## Core entities

#### [**Components**][component-url]

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The main Portal object kind. It is mainly used to refer to a certain 'unit of software',
and refers to a specific project within the company's
Portal. It is normally associated with a link to its
source code. It consumes and provides different APIs,
and has to be managed by defined resources. It is
maintained and used by Users and Groups. Optionally,
it may be a part of a single system and single or multiple domains. It is divided into three main types:

- **Services**: Provides and is related to an API
- **Websites**: Creates or configures a website
- **Libraries**: Is defined as or is a module of a software library

#### [**APIs**][api-url]

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;It refers to an interface exposed by a component. Normally defined as an OpenAPI, AsyncAPI, GraphQL, and gRPC file formats. Is related to a component that has to be owned by a team, and maybe a part of a system.

#### [**Resources**][resources-url]

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Describes a part of the infrastructure system in place needed to manage single or multiple components. It may be related to a single or multiple components and it also may be a part of a single system.

### Example of a Portal Catalogue system

![](https://mermaid.-IFJlc291cmNlMVtSZXNvdXJjZV1cbiAgICAgICAgQVBJMSAtLWNvbm5lY3RzIHRvLS0-IEVudGl0eTNcbiAgICAgICAgUmVzb3VyY2UxLS0gb3BlcmF0ZXMgYW4tLT5FbnRpdHkzXG4gICAgICAgIEVudGl0eTNbRW50aXR5IDNdIC0uIGNhbiBiZSBhIC4tPiBDb21wb25lbnQzW0NvbXBvbmVudF1cbiAgICAgICAgRW50aXR5M1tFbnRpdHkgM10gLS4gY2FuIGJlIGFuIC4tPiBBUEkzW0FQSV1cbiAgICAgICAgRW50aXR5M1tFbnRpdHkgM10gLS4gY2FuIGJlIGEgLi0-IFJlc291cmNlM1tSZXNvdXJjZV1cbiAgICAgICAgZW5kXG4gICAgICAgIHN1YmdyYXBoIEV4YW1wbGUgU3lzdGVtIDJcbiAgICAgICAgRW50aXR5MltFbnRpdHkgMl0gLS4gY2FuIGJlIGEgLi0-IENvbXBvbmVudDJbQ29tcG9uZW50XVxuICAgICAgICBFbnRpdHkyW0VudGl0eSAyXSAtLiBjYW4gYmUgYW4gLi0-IEFQSTJbQVBJXVxuICAgICAgICBFbnRpdHkyW0VudGl0eSAyXSAtLiBjYW4gYmUgYSAuLT4gUmVzb3VyY2UyW1Jlc291cmNlXVxuICAgICAgICBlbmRcbiAgICBlbmQiLCJtZXJtYWlkIjp7InRoZW1lIjoibmV1dHJhbCJ9LCJ1cGRhdGVFZGl0b3IiOmZhbHNlLCJhdXRvU3luYyI6dHJ1ZSwidXBkYXRlRGlhZ3JhbSI6dHJ1ZX0)

<br>

## Additional entities

#### System

- Represents series of components to create an application or platform. It may be composed by a single website, or it may cover an entire array of microservices. The logical structure that defines how broad each system definition will be in terms of what components is composed of, is mainly regarded as something to be defined by each company's discretion when creating Portal resources.

#### User

- Defines a single member or individual of a [**group**][group-url]. It may be a part of a single or multiple [**groups**](group-url), and these joint users entities may be related to multiple other entities of various types. Individuals cannot own a system, only teams (i.e. Groups) can do so.

#### Domain

- It is a concept generic in nature, and can be used to define a series of systems of any kind and nature, and will be mostly used to organize the company's Portal collections of objects in Portal as more components are created and systems start to become series of objects themselves. A domain may have been composed of multiple systems and a system may have multiple domains, although domains can only be owned by a single team/group of Users.

</details>

## Managing entities

The next step is to understand the technical details of how and where these objets should be defined within Portal, this is covered by the next documentation article [writing new entities.](/entities)
